events.message: The applicant submitted their mortgage loan application for a new home purchase, including initial personal and financial details.
Loan application was reviewed and categorised under Mortgage Loan based on keywords such as ‘home’ and ‘property’ mentioned in the submission.
A dedicated loan officer was assigned to handle the mortgage application and to assist the applicant throughout the process.
An initial review of the submitted mortgage application was conducted to verify the completeness and accuracy of the provided information.
Additional documents such as property appraisal, proof of income, and credit history were requested from the applicant to proceed further.
The applicant submitted all requested documents including recent pay stubs, property appraisal report, and signed disclosures.
A credit check was performed to assess the applicant’s creditworthiness and to examine their credit history and score.
The risk team completed an assessment taking into account credit scores, loan-to-value ratio, and debt-to-income ratio to evaluate eligibility.
A mortgage loan offer was presented to the applicant detailing the loan amount, interest rate, repayment schedule, and closing costs.
The applicant provided positive feedback on the mortgage offer and expressed intent to proceed with loan approval.
The application was escalated to senior underwriting for a final detailed review due to high loan amount requested.
Senior underwriting approved the mortgage loan application after thorough review of all documents and assessment results.
The approved mortgage loan amount was successfully funded and disbursed to the closing agent to finalize the home purchase.
Follow-up communication was conducted with the applicant to ensure satisfaction and clarify the repayment plan and next steps.
The mortgage loan application process was officially closed after all tasks were completed and the applicant acknowledged understanding.
